intro: Hedyotis purpurea var. calycosa, commonly known as purple flame or purple balm, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, depending on the variety. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
